DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether time prophylactic antibiotic administration cesarean section ( immediate preoperative versus intraoperative administration ) impact rate postoperative febrile morbidity . The specific aim project test hypothesis preoperative antibiotic administration decrease rate composite postoperative febrile morbidity .
DOC.brief_title: The Timing Prophylactic Antibiotics Cesarean Section Risk Post-operative Febrile Morbidity
DOC.criteria: Gestational age > 36 week Ability understand requirement study Elective/nonemergent cesarean section select route delivery treat physician Known fetal anomaly Exposure antibiotic within 7 day admission , include intrapartum group B streptococcal ( GBS ) prophylaxis Emergent cesarean delivery ( i.e . fetal distress , maternal distress , obstetric hemorrhage ) Overt maternal intrapartum infection require antibiotic Prolonged rupture membrane ( > 18 hour )
